intro: Melampyrum nemorosum var. virens, commonly known as the green devil's bit scabious, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Oxyglossaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and thrives in nutrient-rich soils. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers bloom from June to August. This variety is distinguished by its lighter green flower color compared to the more typical reddish hues of the species.
